intro: Aria zahlbruckneri, commonly known as the Zahnbruckner's Aria, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from orange to red, often attracting specific pollinators. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Aria zahlbruckneri is considered a conservation concern.
